Message:
I may have still been a child,
but I had to survive somehow.

So, I sold myself to a bar
as a dancer.

And used the only thing
my father left me—

The dance was perfect for
heating up the bar,

and I soon became
its poster girl.

I continued to
dance there for years.

I had no trouble with
living arrangements and
everyone took good care of me.

But, my longing to go to
my father’s hometown
never disappeared.
